summary: The Mental Health for Latinos Act of 2025 aims to improve mental health outcomes within the Hispanic and Latino communities. It directs the Secretary, through the Assistant Secretary, to develop an outreach and education strategy to reduce stigma associated with mental health conditions and substance abuse. This strategy will consider cultural and linguistic needs, promote awareness of mental illnesses, provide information on evidence-based treatments, involve community members, and adopt a comprehensive public health approach. The bill also mandates annual reports to Congress and authorizes $1,000,000 in appropriations for fiscal year 2026.
